Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y] Search page a11y fixes for tags and framework filter buttons" (#9429) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9402, https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9412 and https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9413 This PR fixes 3 a11y issues: 1. The tags in search results sometimes appeared on the same line as the other package metadata (version, last created, etc.) and sometimes appeared on the next line. We wanted to make this consistent and always have the 'tags' on the next line, but adding a `
` element in the middle of a list led to this a11y issue: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/225134180-860cebea-4b3e-46a4-bb2d-9eece8107921.png) I've now removed the `
` element and fixed this with some css: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/225132168-62bffd76-acd6-4460-8b58-a549e1a4ee0f.png) 2. The chevrons that expanded/collapsed the TFM sections in the Filters panel did not indicate their expanded/collapsed state. The screen reader should be able to read their state. The 'aria-expanded' can be used to fix this. 3. These chevrons also all had the same 'aria-label': "shows and hides TFM filters". I've now made each button's label relevant to its specific frameworks: eg. "shows and hides TFM filters for .NET Standard".

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update the issue template list to talk about sign in issues" (#9432) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Cannot get packageHash through API v3" (#9433) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet SDK

### Product Version

6.0.400

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

There is no option to collect the packageHash of a NuGet in the API V3 short of:

1. Doing a registration call followed by catalog call (which is a slow thing)
`https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/newtonsoft.json/12.0.3.json` then `https://api.nuget.org/v3/catalog0/data/2022.12.08.16.43.03/newtonsoft.json.12.0.3.json`

2. Calling the (deprecated) V2 XML api instead as in `https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/Packages(Id='newtonsoft.json',Version='12.0.3')`. This does provide the full details including packageHash in a single call.

As a result the only available options to collect a hash (in order to make an important nupkg integrity verification) are either slow or deprecated.

Note that the same is true when using the SDK and making calls to the NuGet Client libraries.

Please add the package hash to the v3 API 


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Cannot sign-in" (#9431) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

My username is bwakabats

My email address is **REDACTED** (I do not have access to this email anymore but can sign-in to it using MS)

My new email address is **REDACTED**

I cannot sign-in to my **REDACTED** account

### Repro Steps

When I sign in as **REDACTED** (using MS) it says "The account with the email **REDACTED** is linked to another Microsoft account."

When I sign in to as **REDACTED** (using MS) I am told "Looks like we don't have an account with this email address (**REDACTED**) in our records." and asks me to sign-up, but I cant use the username "**REDACTED**" because its already taken.

When using the "Need assistance signing in" link, I enter the username "**REDACTED**" and the email address "**REDACTED**" and get an email saying "Our records indicate the associated Microsoft login(s): **REDACTED** **REDACTED**."

### Expected Behavior

I sign-in to my **REDACTED** account using one of the email addresses

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

I cannot sign-in to my bwakabats account

### Repro Steps

When I sign in as bwakabats@gmail.com (using MS) it says "The account with the email bwakabats@gmail.com is linked to another Microsoft account."

When I sign in to as shane.whitehead@werewebsoftware.co.uk (using MS) I am told "Looks like we don't have an account with this email address (shane.whitehead@werewebsoftware.co.uk) in our records." and asks me to sign-up, but I cant use the username "bwakabats" because its already taken.

When using the "Need assistance signing in" link, I enter the username "bwakabats" and the email address "bwakabats@gmail.com" and get an email saying "Our records indicate the associated Microsoft login(s): Shane Whitehead shane.whitehead@werewebsoftware.co.uk."

### Expected Behavior

I sign-in to my bwakabats account using one of the email addresses

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "buildTransitive behavior fails" (#12483) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Other/NA

### Product Version

dotnet 7.0.2  Nuget 6.5.0.136

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

Say I have the following project structure:

```
ProjectA
‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ProjectB
    ‚îÇ
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ProjectC
        ‚îÇ
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ buildTransitive
        ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ
        ‚îÇ    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ProjectC.props
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ MyFiles
              ‚îÇ
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ 1.txt   2.txt   3.txt
```

ProjectC.csproj
```
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramewrok>net6.0</TargetFramewrok>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>

<ItemGroup>
  <None Include="buildTransitive\**">
    <Pack>true</Pack>
    <PackagePath>buildTransitive</PackagePath>
  </None>

  <Content Include="MyFiles\**">
    <Pack>true</Pack>
    <PackageCopyToOutput>true</PackageCopyToOutput>
    <PackagePath>contentFiles\MyFiles</PackagePath>
    <CopyToOutputDirectory>Always</CopyToOutputDirectory>
  </Content >
</ItemGroup>
```

ProjectC.props:
```
<Project>
  <ItemGroup>
    <Content Include="$(MSBuildThisFileDirectory)..\contentFiles\MyFiles\**">
      <CopyToOutputDirectory>Always</CopyToOutputDirectory>
      <Link>%(RecursiveDir)%(Filename)%(Extension)</Link>
    </Content>
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

Both ProjectB and ProjectC are Nuget packages, and ProjectA only references ProjectB.

When my ProjectA is a Framework project (net48), the buildTransitive of the indirectly dependent ProjectC fails, and the content files will not be copied to the output directory of ProjectA, but when my ProjectA project is an SDK-style .net core When projecting, everything is normal.

I want to know why when the .net core project indirectly depends on the Nuget package, the dependency file will be copied to the output directory normally, but the .net Framework project will not. Thanks!



### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Confusing error message for -MSBuildPath argument in the English resource file of the Nuget.CommandLine client." (#12461) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

nuget.exe v.6.4.0.123

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

Description:
When the -MsBuildPath doesn't exist the command line returns an error saying that the directory "doesn't not exist". Which is confusing since the error stems from a Directory.Exists() == false check. 

Reproduce:
1. Execute the restore command and specify an non-existent path in the -MSBuildPath argument

Expected:
A well formed sentence explaining that the path does not exists

Actual:
The sentence returned contains the double negative "doesn't not exist"

### Verbose Logs

```shell
nuget.exe restore testProject.sln -MsBuildPath 'c:\some_non_existent_path'
Using Msbuild from 'c:\some_non_existent_path'
MSBuildPath : c:\some_non_existent_path doesn't not exist.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Remove netstandard2.0 and netcoreapp3.1 legs for projects that only work as distribution vehicles, NuGet.Build.Tasks, NuGet.Build.Tasks.Console, NuGet.Commandline.Xplat and Microsoft.Build.NugetSdkResolver" (#12489) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Before:

  Microsoft.Build.NuGetSdkResolver.csproj = net472;netstandard2.0;netcoreapp5.0
  NuGet.Build.Tasks.Console.csproj = net472;netcoreapp3.1;netcoreapp5.0
  NuGet.Build.Tasks.csproj = net472;netstandard2.0;netcoreapp5.0
  NuGet.CommandLine.XPlat.csproj = net472;netcoreapp3.1;netcoreapp5.0

After:

  Microsoft.Build.NuGetSdkResolver.csproj = net472;netcoreapp5.0
  NuGet.Build.Tasks.Console.csproj = net472;netcoreapp5.0
  NuGet.Build.Tasks.csproj = net472;netcoreapp5.0
  NuGet.CommandLine.XPlat.csproj = net472;netcoreapp5.0

These changes should have no effect to anyone.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: Multitargeting fails to include PackageReadmeFile" (#12485) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
---
**Issue moved from dotnet/msbuild#8518**
- Please respond to @miloush.

---

_From @miloush on Wednesday, March 1, 2023 11:18:16 PM_

### Issue Description

When multitargeting using `<TargetFrameworks>`, `<None Update` items are not included in the build, making the `PackTask` fail when trying to pack content such as a readme file.

@KirillOsenkov 

### Steps to Reproduce

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFrameworks>net8.0</TargetFrameworks>
    <GeneratePackageOnBuild>True</GeneratePackageOnBuild>
    <PackageReadmeFile>README.md</PackageReadmeFile>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <None Update="README.md" Pack="true" PackagePath="\" />
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```
\+ something to compile and non-empty _README.md_

### Expected Behavior

Build succeeds.

### Actual Behavior

```
error NU5039: The readme file 'README.md' does not exist in the package.
```

Build succeeds when either `<TargetFramework>` singular is used instead of multitagerting, or, when `<None Include` is used rather than `<None Update`.

### Analysis

In the multitargeting scenario, the first evaluation of the project does not contain `<None>` items, so _\_GetPackageFiles_ target does not produce any items and as a result the readme file is not included in nuspec, hence the error.

### Versions & Configurations

MSBuild version 17.6.0-preview-23081-04+7bf511372
OS version 25300.1000.amd64fre.rs_prerelease.230210-1451
.NET SDK version 8.0.100-preview.1.23115.2

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cant download packages from NuGet on Visual Studio 2022" (#12488) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

dotnet 7.0.202

### Worked before?

Worked, idk version.

### Impact

Other

### Repro Steps & Context

Hi. I cant use NuGet on my Visual Studio, when im trying to download some packages im getting an errors which u can see in screen:
![err](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66569047/225614040-795f0304-6717-47b7-948c-08ab593f55e6.png)

* My "C:\Users\antik\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config" file is:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<configuration>
    <packageSources>
        <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" />
    </packageSources>
</configuration>
```

> i tried to disable signature validation like this (but result is 0):

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<configuration>
    <packageSources>
        <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" />
    </packageSources>
    <config>
        <add key="signatureValidationMode" value="accept" />
    </config>
</configuration>
```

* This is result of "dotnet --info":
![dotnet info](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66569047/225615264-160ec76d-e759-466b-b95c-efcceafb531d.png)

* Im using:
- Windows 10 x64 1809 LTSC
- Visual Studio 2022

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

[Rendered Spec](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/blob/dev-feature-vinr/proposed/2022/vulnerabilities-in-restore.md)

Please üëç or üëé this comment to help us with the direction of this feature & leave as much feedback/questions/concerns as you'd like on this issue itself and we will get back to you shortly.

Thank You üéâ

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Cross-platform Dotnet NuGet Sign] Duplicated ‚ÄúX.509 certificate chain validation‚Äù info showed after running command ‚Äúdotnet nuget sign‚Äù and ‚Äúdotnet nuget verify‚Äù on Windows" (#12339) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

.NET SDK Version: 7.0.101

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps:

1. Execute the [dotnet nuget sign pre-step](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7b8a3c6685-1661-47f4-8807-b765ca62aea1%7d&action=edit&wd=target%28Package%20Signing%20Manual%20Test.one%7C0344a15b-01b1-4828-af4c-63fe53687f8a%2FDotnet%20nuget%20sign%20pre-step%7C708e56b6-a296-493e-a615-e0e18c55f96f%2F%29&wdorigin=703&&sdata=YUwxQmlxODc0WGxNT2gzbEd0bGxMMnMyQkJScU1wUVd4eXVRUXppRFkxVT0%3D&ovuser=72f988bf-86f1-41af-91ab-2d7cd011db47%2Cv-cicili%40microsoft.com).

2. On Windows: Create a new test certificate: ` .\CreateTestCertificate.ps1 -AddAsTrustedRootAuthority -Password password -GenerateCerFile `(in the powershell "Developer Command Prompt").

3. Use the patched "dotnet.exe" to sign a package. Where <PackageFilePath> is the test package path and <PfxFilePath> is the file path to the .pfx file, sign the test package: 

On Windows: ` .\patchedSDK .\dotnet.exe nuget sign <PackageFilePath> --overwrite --certificate-path <PfxFilePath> --certificate-password password --timestamper http://timestamp.digicert.com/ -v n`

4. Verify that the package is signed successfully in the output, with no warnings and no errors

Package(s) signed successfully.

5. Use the patched "dotnet.exe" to verify a package. 

On Windows: ` .\patchedSDK .\dotnet.exe nuget verify <PackageFilePath> -v d` 

#### Expected:‚ÄØ

There is only one ‚ÄúX.509 certificate chain validation‚Äù info after step3 and step5.

#### Actual:‚ÄØ

Duplicated ‚ÄúX.509 certificate chain validation‚Äù info showed after step5 and step7 as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84695155/209935806-dbd393e7-fc87-441e-8ea2-c74a51b84238.png)

#### Note:
1. It only reproes on Windows, on Linux/MacBook the ‚ÄúX.509 certificate chain validation‚Äù info is:
```
X.509 certificate chain validation will use the fallback certificate bundle at '/home/jamie/Desktop/patchSDK/sdk/7.0.101/trustedroots/codesignctl.pem'.
X.509 certificate chain validation will use the fallback certificate bundle at '/home/jamie/Desktop/patchSDK/sdk/7.0.101/trustedroots/timestampctl.pem'.
```
2. It doesn't repro on .NET SDK 6.0.
### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Moving to the new .NET Foundation CLA service" (#68) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello everyone
The .NET Foundation is transitioning to a new CLA service and I'm posting here to let you know it's happening. Some background info:

The new CLA service is based off of https://github.com/microsoft/ContributorLicenseAgreement, except it uses the dotnet-policy-service app

- Current contributors do not need to sign the CLA again
- The CLA agreement itself is not changing
- As part of the install/configuration process, the following work items will be completed

1. Create a .github repo if it doesn't exist already
2. Install the dotnet-policy-service app
3. Create PRs for the platformcontext.xml and cla.yml files
4. Disable the existing CLA webhook
5. Push the PRs to enable the new CLA service

That's all there is to it. I'll update this issue once the work is complete

Thanks
Chris
.NET Foundation Operations team

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Moving to the new .NET Foundation CLA service" (#68) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello everyone
The .NET Foundation is transitioning to a new CLA service and I'm posting here to let you know it's happening. Some background info:

The new CLA service is based off of https://github.com/microsoft/ContributorLicenseAgreement, except it uses the dotnet-policy-service app

- Current contributors do not need to sign the CLA again
- The CLA agreement itself is not changing
- As part of the install/configuration process, the following work items will be completed

1. Create a .github repo if it doesn't exist already
2. Install the dotnet-policy-service app
3. Create PRs for the platformcontext.xml and cla.yml files
4. Disable the existing CLA webhook
5. Push the PRs to enable the new CLA service

That's all there is to it. I'll update this issue once the work is complete

Thanks
Chris
.NET Foundation Operations team

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.org migration towards a new multi-CDN infrastructure" (#60) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
In the coming weeks, nuget.org will be migrating towards a new multi-CDN infrastructure that will improve the experience of our users. This change allows our team flexibility to switch to a back-up provider in the case that one CDN is down, which will broaden coverage for our users.

Some changes are coming for older TLS cipher suites, which may result in connectivity issues. From our data we believe this will affect only a small percentage of requests. We will be monitoring all feedback channels during the migration to assess impact and adjust our roll-out timeline as needed.

Below, we provide resources to determine whether you will be affected by this change. This utilizes the [.NET CLI](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/) to install a package from our pre-production (INT) environment which tests connectivity:


```
mkdir cdn-test
cd cdn-test
dotnet new classlib
dotnet add package BaseTestPackage.NetStandard --source https://apiint.nugettest.org/v3/index.json
```

If you are experiencing connectivity issues while connecting to nuget.org or restoring packages from https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json, such as:

"The SSL connection could not be established"

Please ensure that TLS 1.2 and any of the following cipher suites have been enabled on your machine:

TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256

If you have any questions, do reach out to us at‚ÄØsupport@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue:‚ÄØNuGet/Home#11058
